intro: Jugastrum subcinctum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Jugastrum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
